intro: Amphorkis squamosa, commonly known as the scaly orchid, is a species of flowering plant in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly in countries like South Africa and Namibia. The plant is characterized by its unique, scaly appearance on its leaves and stems, which gives it its common name. It produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Amphorkis squamosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments.
